title.narrative: STITCH Bangladesh

description.narrative: As the Sustainable Textile Initiative: Together for Change (STITCH) consortium, we envision a global garment industry that contributes to an equal and just society by respecting human rights in the world of work. The global garment industry is fragmented and complex, involving many actors across the globe, with varying levels of power and influence.
ETI BD actual spend for 1 year of STITCH project 01.01.2021-31.12.2021
Funds received from ETI UK during 1 year of STITCH project from 01.01.2021-31.12.2021

title.narrative: Local partners and STITCH form coalitions with allies to drive lobby and advocacy efforts for the new normal in the global garment industry
Number of common positions and joint statements submitted for policies, laws or guiding principles on main Lobby and Advocacy goals/strategies

description.narrative: Any formal joint statements or common positions shared by STITCH with outside stakeholders as part of lobby and advocacy efforts. This is a joint activity indicator (with contributions from multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

comment.narrative: In 2021, only one common positions was submitted enactment of sexual harassment law and ratification of C190.

title.narrative: Factories and business associations are capacitated for social dialogue and sourcing dialogue
Number of stories of change on social dialogue

description.narrative: Case examples where programs efforts to improve social dialogue have led to learning opportunities

title.narrative: Innovative and improved approaches to remedy are implemented for garment workers
Number of stories on change on remediation and redressals

description.narrative: Case examples where programs remediation and redressal efforts have led to learning opportunities

title.narrative: Reach
Total unique CSOs (not youth or women led) supported through capacity strengthening by STITCH

description.narrative: Neither women led nor youth led Labor right organizations that have received training from STITCH on one of the following topics: leadership skills, purchasing practices, social dialogue, sourcing dialogue, gender awareness, policy influencing lobby and advocacy, monitoring and evaluation or other topics

comment.narrative: The L&A capacity of the CSOs will be assessed and capacity building on L&A will be provided as per needs. In all cases, STITCH tools/methodologies/research will be shared.

title.narrative: Total unique CSOs (women-led) supported through capacity strengthening by STITCH

description.narrative: Women-led Labor right organizations that have received capactiy strengthening from STITCH on one of the following topics: leadership skills, purchasing practices, social dialogue, sourcing dialogue, gender awareness, policy influencing lobby and advocacy, monitoring and evaluation or other topics

comment.narrative: The L&A capacity of the CSOs will be assessed and capacity building on L&A will be provided as per needs. In all cases, STITCH tools/methodologies/research will be shared.

title.narrative: Total second tier CSO partners (not youth or women led) of STITCH

description.narrative: Includes second tier partners (neither women led nor youth led) excluding trade uinons

comment.narrative: the baseline values have been taken as 0, because even though STITCH members did partner with some of the first and second tier CSOs in their past projects, but new partnership contracts were drawn at start of STITCH program with all.

title.narrative: Total second tier CSO partners (women-led) of STITCH

description.narrative: Includes second tier partners (women led) excluding trade uinons

comment.narrative: the baseline values have been taken as 0, because even though STITCH members did partner with some of the first and second tier CSOs in their past projects, but new partnership contracts were drawn at start of STITCH program with all.

title.narrative: Number of LROs and TUs supported by STITCH

description.narrative: DDE indicator. Number of labor rights organizations and Trade Unions supported by STITCH in fragile states. LROs are supported through capacity strengthening while TUs are supported through capacity support and/or financial support by the program. Capacity support can be in form of sharing of tools/methodologies/ research and provide training/ webinars/ learning sessions to LROs and TUs on different topics such as Policy Influencing Lobby and Advocacy, leadership skills, purchasing practices, social dialogue, gender guidance etc.

title.narrative: Increased collaboration
Number of functional coalitions/networks/platforms in which STITCH participates

description.narrative: Coalitions are partnerships among distinct actors that coordinate action in pursuit of shared goals. Networks are forms of organization characterized by voluntary and reciprocal patterns of communication and exchange. Platform is a declaration of the principles on which a group of persons stands. This is a joint activity indicator (with contributions from multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

title.narrative: Number of influencing activities held with policymakers, companies, influential decision-makers on key STITCH Lobby and Advocacy goals/strategies

description.narrative: Influencing activities include dialogues, meetings, consultations, briefings, seminars, workshops, conferences, summits, etc. held with policymakers, companies, influential decision-makers on main STITCH issues, claims and policy goals

comment.narrative: ETI aims to conduct 7 L&A activities with different actors such as government officials, political leaders, media personnel, directly engaged brands (member brands of ETI or FW), indirectly engaged brands (not member brands of ETI or FW), TUs/ LRO and other actors towards improvement of labor rights.

title.narrative: Improved information sharing with TUs, LROs, and brands for collaboration
Total multi-stakeholder structures in which STITCH members participate

description.narrative: Multi-stakeholder structures are country level/locally driven structures with partnership from multiple stakeholders such as trade unions, government, embassies, brands, suppliers, CSOs etc. This is a joint activity indicator (with multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

title.narrative: Number of times multi-stakeholder structures have convened to have dialogue about key industry issues

description.narrative: Multi-stakeholder structures are country level/locally driven structures with partnership from multiple stakeholders such as trade unions, government, embassies, brands, suppliers, CSOs etc. This is a joint activity indicator (with multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting

comment.narrative: Due to Covid 19, more meetings than planned were required to come up with systems to support labor rights.

title.narrative: Conduct research to create evidence on labour conditions
Number of reports focused on labor conditions (e.g. studies, publication, position papers) conducted

description.narrative: Number of reports (e.g. studies, publication, position papers) focused on labour conditions conducted and published by the program

title.narrative: Governments in production and EU buying countries create the opportunity to change and for inclusion of workers voices in negotiations and decision-making
Total number of government policies, laws, judgements and agreements adapted/ changed/ blocked in favour of STITCH goals in fragile states, contributed to the interventions of the program

description.narrative: DDE indicator. Total number of government policies, laws, judgements and agreements adapted/ changed/ blocked in favour of STITCH goals in fragile states, contributed to the interventions of the program. This is a joint activity indicator (with contributions from multiple STITCH partners), and is only reported by this STITCH partner to avoid double counting
